sentence.idiomatic: Every time she brings up how it feels to be a mother, we all really envy her.
That matter is too painful for him. If he doesn't want to bring it up, you mustn't ask.
Don't bring it up. In the last while i've been crazily busy--I have absolutely no time to go out and have fun.
She has to breast-feed her baby every three hours.
While mom was breast-feeding him, he kept on squirming--he's really not behaving.
The baby won't stop crying, could it be that he's hungry? Should you breast-feed him?
The doctor recommended that feeding the baby breast milk would be beneficial.
Breast milk is full of nutrition. It is the most ideal food for newborn babies.

word.literal: to not have available to eat

sentence.idiomatic: Taking the surplus breast milk of healthy mothers and collecting it to give to babies who don't have breast milk available to them--this is a good practice.
Although she is very tired, she perseveres in feeding breast milk to her baby.
If there is not enough breast milk, you can choose a suitable powdered milk formula to feed the baby.
Feeding an animal every day is a very tiring thing. Only if you have a lot of patience can you do it.
Lately his health hasn't been too good. He played half the game, and had no more strength.
In such hot weather, to have to stand outside for two hours--I definitely don't have the strength to tolerate it.
She rested for a week, and finally recovered her strength.
Actually, traveling is an especially draining thing.
I've heard that exercising consumes a lot of calories. If you want to lose weight then you should exercise more.
Reading this kind of academic thesis uses up too much energy, your brain has to keep thinking non-stop.
I have come to an agreement with him. Today it is him that will be in charge of cleaning the room.
You are in charge of this project--when a problem comes up, of course I will look for you.
There is a clear division of labor between the two of us. I am in charge of production; he is in charge of marketing.
The baby must have peed--why don't you change his diaper.
I haven't changed the baby's diaper in a while, he must be feeling very uncomfortable.
Don't move. Daddy is changing your diaper.
The baby won't stop crying, go and soothe him.
There are a lot of ways to soothe a child to go to bed--for example, telling him a story.
These past couple days his girlfriend hasn't been in a great mood. He's thought of a bunch of ways to soothe her into feeling happy.
Long time no see. Are you happy to be a mom?
Oh, don't bring it up. I'm about to die of exhaustion.

word.literal: to take care of a child

sentence.idiomatic: Isn't your mom helping you with the child?
But there are a lot of things I still have to do myself. For example, nursing. I breast-feed, so it really consumes a lot of energy.
Yeah. Does your husband help you?
Of course. He's in charge of changing diapers and rocking the baby to sleep.
Do you sing for the baby?
Of course. He especially likes that! Hey, do you know what I find most tiring?
Ummm... no.
I can't sleep well at night because as soon as the child cries, we have to go over and take a look.

word.literal: to take care of a child
